result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Sexton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
From State dated 8/30/16 requesting to have register condition to be as a condition of 4th degree sexual assault.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 9/3/16; Issue and order correcting the JOC to reflect sex registry on one of the Fourth Degree Sexual assaults.
Curriculum Vitae of Christopher T Tyre Phd

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The defendant was sentenced to the following:
Count #1:

HUBER:  9 MONTHS, w/Standard Release Conditions.  Sentence to begin forthwith.  
COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation on 15CF1339).
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid as a condition of probation on 15CF1339).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
EXPUNCTION: Expunction is not granted.
Comprehensive clinical evaulation from Dr. Christopher Tyre dated 5/2/16.

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1of the amended information.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Court revokes bail.  Sentencing hearing remains as previously set.
Sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties are not ready to proceed as the State needs to file an amended information.  The Court will take the plea on April 25, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  and schedule a sentencing date in approximately 3 weeks.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden advises the Court the parties have reached an agreement.    The Defendant is sworn in and waives his right to a jury trial.  Attorney Menden withdraws her request for a speedy trial.    The Court adjourns the trial and sets the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
State's Notice of Intent to Use DVD Statement at Jury Trial Pursuant to Sections 970.03 and/or 908.08, Stats.
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-01-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 02-24-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the competency report filed.  Attorney Menden is not contesting the finding.  Attorney Menden requests the Court amend bail to allow the Defendant to be transferred to the Huber Facility on 15CF1339.  The State objects to the modification of the bail. The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Attorney Menden enters a speedy trial demand on the record.  The Court set 15CF1130 for trial and the other case to tag along.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing at 01-06-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Matthew D Sexton in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden request the Court order a competency report be prepared.  The Court orders a report be prepared and the matter be set for a hearing to review the report.  Attorney Masnica request that court modify bail to $1000.00 cash.  The State objects to any modification of bail.    The Court denies the motion for bail modification.   The Court to prepare order for competency report to be filed by December 30, 2015 in 30 days.  Review hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 09:30 am
